intro: Senecio obovatus var. umbratilis, commonly known as the shade-loving groundsels, is a variant of the Senecio obovatus species characterized by its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. It is a perennial herb with upright stems and lanceolate, slightly hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa and prefers well-drained soil and moderate moisture. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in shaded garden settings.
